casebody.data:
In the Matter of THE PURPORTED LAST WILL AND TESTAMENT OF FRANCIS M. BARNES Dated November 22, 1989 and in the Matter of the Purported Last Will and Testament of Francis M. Barnes, Dated May 25, 1967. No. 262A03. Supreme Court of North Carolina. June 24, 2004. Danny D. McNally, Greenville, Emma S. Holscher, for Riley S. Corddry. Myron T. Hill, Jr., Greenville, for Diane Graue. Stephen A. Dunn, Raleigh, Raymond E. Dunn, Jr., New Bern, for Lucy Tull. Marvin Blount, Jr., Greenville, Ted Mackall, Jr., Rebecca Cameron Blount, for Caveators, Beneficiaries of the 1967 Will of Francis M. Barnes. John Walter Bryant, Eva C. Currin, Raleigh, Jeffrey A. Batts, Joseph L. Bell, Jr., Rocky Mount, Wendy P. Wilson, for Propounders of 1989 Will of Estate of Francis M. Barnes. Gregory S. Camp, Rocky Mount, for Church of the Advent. Charles J. Murray, Special Deputy Attorney General, for ECU Athletic Fund.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed by Propounder-Appellee (Propounder of 1989 Will) on the 6th day of April 2004 for rehearing of the decision of this Court pursuant to Rule 31, N.C. Rules of Appellate Procedure, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Dismissed by order of the Court in conference, this the 24th day of June 2004."
